name: Cook the Book: Tomato, Pomegranate and Sumac Salad
description: Some believe that summer tomatoes need nothing more than a sprinkle of salt for that perfect tomato experience. I'm betting those folks haven't tried tomatoes sprinkled with sumac, the sour-aromatic red spice. Of course, the Turks have known about sumac's affinity for tomatoes for a while. This Tomato, Pomegranate and Sumac Salad from Silvena Rowe's Purple Citrus & Sweet Perfume tops lovely, in-season tomatoes with crunchy ruby-hued pomegranate seeds and a dressing of sweet and tart pomegranate molasses and sumac.
recipeIngredient: sea salt and freshly ground pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the tomatoes and place in a large bowl. Add the pomegranate seeds and combine. Mix together the olive oil, pomegranate molasses, sumac, and cumin in a bowl. Pour over the salad, season with salt and pepper and gently toss. Serve at once.
